ext_descriptions.ext_description: The Expression module represents expression itself. It can represent a numeric, boolean and a string expression.

An And_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the 'AND' operator defined in ISO 10303-11 and uses its associativity property to handle multiple arity.The AND operator requires at least two Boolean expressions and evaluates to a Boolean value that is the conjunction of the two operands.
A Binary_boolean_expression is a type of and . It shall be one of a or an . It is a binary operator of which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Binary_numeric_expression is a type of and . It shall be a subtype of either a , a , a , a and a . It is a binary operator of which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
a list containing the two parameters of the binary operator.
A Boolean_defined_function is a type of and . It is any application-defined operator of which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Boolean_expression is a type of . It shall be one of a , an , a , a , a , an or a . A Boolean_expression is an for which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Boolean_literal is a type of and . It is an EXPRESS BOOLEAN literal.The EXPRESS Boolean data type has as its domain the set containing the two literals TRUE and FALSE.

ext_description.note: The EXPRESS Boolean data type has as its domain the set containing the two literals TRUE and FALSE.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Boolean_variable is a type of and . It is a variable that stands for a Boolean value.

A Comparison_equal is a type of carries the semantics of the value equal ('=') operator defined in ISO 10303-11 restricted to the NUMBER, BOOLEAN and STRING EXPRESS data types. Both operands shall have the same data type.The Comparison_equal evaluates to TRUE if the two operands evaluate to the same value.

A Comparison_expression is a type of and a . It shall be one of a , a , a , a , a , a or a . The Comparison_expression expressions carry the semantics of the different value comparison operators defined in ISO 10303-11 restricted to the NUMBER, BOOLEAN and STRING EXPRESS data types. Both operands shall have the same data type.
a list of s that contains the expressions to be compared.
the operands of the Comparison_expression shall be of compatible in type.

A Concat_expression is a type of and . It carries the semantics of the concatenation ('+') operator defined in ISO 10303-11, on the STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
The Concat_expression operator accepts at least two as operands and evaluates to a string value resulting from the concatenation of all the elements of the list. These elements are concatenated in the list order.
the to be concatenated.
A Defined_function is a type of one of or or and or . It is a (strongly typed) function intended to be subtyped in the information models that use the ISO13584_expressions_schema.

A Div_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the EXPRESS 'DIV' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.
The Div_expression is an expression which evaluates to the integer division of its operands. In the ISO13584_expressions_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is an integer number. If either operand is of data type REAL, it is truncated to an INTEGER before the operation, i.e. any fractional part is lost.

An Equals_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the ':=:' instance equal operator defined in ISO 10303-11, the domain of which is entities of data type .
The entity instance equality operator accepts two compatible instance values that are and evaluates to a Boolean value. In the context of the ISO13584_expressions_schema the two s instance values are compatible either if their data types are the same, or if one data type is a subtype of the other one.
An Expression is a type of . It shall be a supertype of either a , or a or a . It is restricted to numeric, boolean, string or any other suitable domain of values.
A Format_function is a type of and . It carries the semantics of the FORMAT function defined in ISO 10303-11.
the to be formatted.
the formatting commands that defines the appearance of the result.
the shall be a and the shall be a .

An Index_expression is a type of and . It carries the semantics of the string indexing operator ('[]') defined in ISO 10303-11.
The Index_expression string operator takes two operands, the string value (represented by the attribute) being indexed by the index specification (represented by the attribute). The resulting string value is the character at position the value of the operator.
the that represents the STRING.
the integer that indicates the index value.
the first operand shall be a and the second operand shall be a .
the position described by the index operand shall be an integer value.

An Int_literal is a type of . It is an EXPRESS INTEGER literal.
An EXPRESS INTEGER literal represents an integer VALUE that is composed of one or more digits.
an INTEGER literal value.
An Int_numeric_variable is a type of . It is a variable that stands for an integer value.
the operand of the interval expression (see 12.2.4 of ISO 10303-11).
the operand of the interval expression (see 12.2.4 of ISO 10303-11).
the operand of the interval expression (see 12.2.4 of ISO 10303-11).
the data type of the operands shall be .
the types of the to be compared in the shall evaluates to comparable .

A Like_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the LIKE string matching operator defined in ISO 10303-11. The first operand is the target string. The second operand is the pattern string. The special characters (often called "wild cards") in the pattern string are defined in ISO 10303-11
the operand list shall contain two s instances that are .

A Literal_number is a type of and . It shall be a subtype of either an and . It is an EXPRESS NUMBER literal . A Literal_number may be either an integer literal or a real literal.
The EXPRESS NUMBER data type has the numeric values as domain
a NUMBER literal value.

A Minus_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the '-' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.
The Minus_expression is an expression which evaluates to the difference of its operands. In the ISO13584_expressions_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain.

A Mod_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the EXPRESS 'MOD' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.
The Mod_expression is an expression which evaluates to the first argument value modulo operation of the second argument value. Its operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is an integer number. If either operand is of data type REAL, it is truncated to an INTEGER before the operation, i.e. any fractional part is lost.

A Mult_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the '*' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.
The Mult_expression is an expression which evaluates to the difference of its operands. In the ISO13584_expressions_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain.

A Multiple_arity_boolean_expression is a type of and . It shall be one of or an . It is a multiple-arity operator for which the range is the same as the EXPRESS BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
the occurrences of that represents the parameters of the m-arity operator.
A Multiple_arity_function_call is a type of . It shall be a subtype of either a and . It is a multiple-arity operator on NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.

A Multiple_arity_numeric_expression is a type of and . It shall be a subtype of either a , and . A Multiple_arity_numeric_expression is a multiple arity operator whose range is the NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
a list containing the parameters of the multiple arity operator. The length of this list is equal to the arity of the operator.

A Not_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the 'NOT' on Boolean data type operator defined in ISO 10303-11.
The NOT operator requires one Boolean operand and evaluates to a Boolean value.
the that represents the operand of the 'NOT' operator.
A Numeric_expression is a type of . It shall be a subtype of either a , , , , and . A Numeric_expression is an expression of which the range is the NUMBER data type defined in 8.1.1 of ISO 10303-11.
a Boolean attribute that indicates if an expression evaluates to integer or not.
a Boolean attribute that indicates if an expression is mappable to the SQL, defined in ISO/IEC 9075:1992, query language.
A Numeric_variable is a type of and . It shall be a subtype of either an , or a or a . It is a variable that stands for a number value.
A Numeric_variable can only be a real variable or an integer variable.

An Or_expression is a type of entity carries the semantics of the 'OR' operator defined in ISO 10303-11 and uses its associativity property to handle multiple arity. The OR operator requires at least two Boolean expressions and evaluates to a Boolean value that is the inclusive disjunction of the two operands.

A Plus_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the '+' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.
The Plus_expression is an expression which evaluates to the sum of all its operands. In the ISO13584_expressions_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain.

A Power_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the EXPRESS '**' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type
The Power_expression is an expression which evaluates to the first argument value modulo operation of the second argument value. Its operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is an integer number. If either operand is of data type REAL, it is truncated to an INTEGER before the operation, i.e. any fractional part is lost.

A Real_literal is a type of . It is an EXPRESS REAL literal.An EXPRESS REAL literal represents a real VALUE that is composed of a mantissa and an optional exponent; the mantissa shall include a decimal point.
a REAL literal value.
A Real_numeric_variable is a type of . It is a variable that stands for a real value.
A Simple_boolean_expression is a type of and . It shall be one of a , or a and it is an unary operator for which the range is BOOLEAN, such a data type being defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Simple_numeric_expression is a type of and . It shall be a subtype of either a and . It is either a numeric literal or a numeric variable.
A Simple_string_expression is a type of and is an unary operator of whose range is EXPRESS STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.

A Slash_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the EXPRESS '/' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.
The Slash_expression is an expression which evaluates to the first argument value modulo operation of the second argument value. Its operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is an integer number. If either operand is of data type REAL, it is truncated to an INTEGER before the operation, i.e. any fractional part is lost.

A Sql_mappable_defined_function is a type of . It is a function intended to be subtyped in the information models that use the ISO13584_expressions_schema to specify that some is mappable onto SQL, defined in ISO/IEC 9075:1992.
A String_defined_function is a type of and . It is any application-defined operator of which the range is the STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A String_expression is a type of and whose range is the EXPRESS STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A String_literal is a type of and . It is an EXPRESS STRING literal.The EXPRESS STRING data type has as its domain sequences of characters.
a STRING literal value.
A String_variable is a type of and . It is a variable that stands for a STRING value.

A Substring_expression is a type of and . It carries the semantics of the EXPRESS substring indexing operator ('[:]') defined in ISO 10303-11.
The Substring_expression string operator takes three operands, the string value (represented by the attribute) being indexed by the index specification (represented by the and attributes). The Substring_expression evaluates to a string value of length ( - + 1). The resulting string value is equivalent to the sequence of characters at position through .
the from which a substring is extracted.
the that indicates the low bound of the substring in .
the that indicates the high bound of the substring in .
operand shall be a , index1 and index2 shall be a .
the operands LIST shall contain three elements.
the shall evaluate to an INTEGER value.
the shall evaluate to an INTEGER value.
A Unary_boolean_expression is a type of and . It shall be one of a , or an . It is an unary operator for which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Unary_numeric_expression is a type of and . It shall be a subtype of . It is an unary operator whose range is the NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
a that represents the parameter of the unary operator.

A Xor_expression is a type of . It carries the semantics of the 'XOR' operator defined in ISO 10303-11.The XOR operator requires two Boolean operands and evaluates to a Boolean value that is the exclusive disjunction of the two operands.
the two operands of the XOR operator that shall be .
The Is_sql_mappable function checks if the acyclic graph that represents an expression only contains elements that are mappable to SQL, defined in ISO/IEC 9075:1992.
an .
The Is_int_expr function checks if a syntactically correct expression evaluates to an integer value or not.
it is a .
